emergencies.title: Severe Bleeding
steps: Call emergency services immediately.
Make the person lie down to prevent fainting.
Apply firm, direct pressure on the wound using a clean cloth or gauze.
Maintain pressure for at least 10 minutes. Do NOT lift the cloth to check.
If blood soaks through, place another cloth on top. Do NOT remove the first one.
Do not remove objects stuck deeply in the wound.
Keep the injured part raised above heart level if possible.
red_flags: Bleeding does not stop after applying pressure
Person feels cold, pale, or becomes unconscious (Shock)
Blood is spurting out in a rhythm

emergencies.title: Burns (Fire / Hot Liquid)
steps: Move the person away from the heat source immediately.
Cool the burn with cool running water for 20 minutes. (Crucial step).
Remove jewelry or tight clothing near the burn before swelling starts.
Cover the burn with plastic cling film or a clean, non-fluffy cloth.
Do NOT apply ice, butter, toothpaste, or creams.
Do NOT burst any blisters.
red_flags: Burn is larger than the patient's hand
Burn is on the face, hands, or genitals
Skin looks white, leathery, or charred

emergencies.title: Choking
steps: Ask 'Are you choking?'. If they cannot speak or cough, act immediately.
Stand behind them and lean them slightly forward.
Give 5 sharp back blows between the shoulder blades with the heel of your hand.
If that fails, perform 5 Abdominal Thrusts (Heimlich Maneuver).
Repeat cycle: 5 Back Blows, 5 Abdominal Thrusts.
If they become unconscious, start CPR.

emergencies.title: Snake Bite
steps: Move away from the snake immediately.
Keep the person completely calm and still. Movement spreads venom.
Immobilize the bitten limb and keep it at heart level.
Remove tight clothing, rings, or watches near the bite.
Do NOT cut the wound, suck the venom, or apply ice.
Take the person to the nearest hospital immediately.

emergencies.title: Electric Shock
steps: Do NOT touch the person if they are still in contact with the power source.
Turn off the main power source immediately.
If you cannot turn off power, push the person away using a dry wooden stick or plastic object.
Check for breathing. If not breathing, start CPR immediately.
Treat any burns with cool water.

emergencies.title: Fracture / Broken Bone
steps: Do not move the person unless they are in immediate danger.
Support the injured limb with padding to prevent movement.
Do NOT try to straighten the bone or push it back in.
Apply an ice pack wrapped in a cloth to reduce swelling.
Take the person to the nearest hospital.
red_flags: Bone is sticking out through the skin
Limb feels cold, numb, or turns blue

emergencies.title: Unconscious Person
steps: Check surroundings for danger.
Shake shoulders gently and shout to check response.
If no response, tilt head back to open airway.
Check breathing for 10 seconds.
If breathing: Roll onto side (Recovery Position).
If NOT breathing: Start CPR (30 compressions, 2 breaths) immediately.

emergencies.title: Seizure / Fits
steps: Note the start time of the seizure.
Clear the area of hard objects to prevent injury.
Place something soft under the head.
Do NOT restrain them. Do NOT put anything in their mouth.
After shaking stops, roll them onto their side.
